summary_points: 1. At the 2025 Annual General Meeting, Trane Technologies plc shareholders elected all twelve nominated directors, approved PwC as independent auditors for fiscal year 2025, and approved several proposals related to share issuance.

2.  Shareholder votes on director elections ranged from 164,028,367 "For" votes (David S. Regnery) to 181,230,330 "For" votes (Matthew F. Pine) out of a total including abstentions and broker non-votes of roughly 180 million votes.
3. There is no mention of future impacts or risks within this section of the 8-K filing.
1. Targa Resources Corp. issued $1.5 billion in senior notes on June 4, 2025, consisting of $750 million in 4.900% Senior Notes due 2030 and $750 million in 5.650% Senior Notes due 2036.
2.  A portion of the net proceeds from the note offering will be used to redeem the company's 6.500% Senior Notes due 2027.

3.  The Underwriting Agreement includes customary indemnification and contribution provisions between Targa Resources Corp. and the underwriters,  potentially exposing the company to future liabilities.
1. Expedia Group, Inc. held its 2025 Annual Meeting of Stockholders on June 3, 2025, where stockholders voted on three proposals including the election of 11 directors.

2.  At the close of business on April 4, 2025, there were 122,041,402 shares of common stock and 5,523,452 shares of Class B common stock outstanding, with a quorum of 164,953,983 votes represented at the meeting.
3. Ernst & Young LLP was ratified as the Company’s independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2025.
1. On June 5th, 2025, Linde plc issued CHF 225 million in 0.6150% notes due 2029 and CHF 275 million in 1.0629% notes due 2033, using the net proceeds for general corporate purposes.
2.  The notes were issued under Linde plc’s €20 billion debt issuance programme, which will require updating by May 8th, 2026.
3.  The company appointed UBS AG as the Swiss listing and paying agent for the notes.

1. EOG Resources, Inc. (EOG) announced on June 5, 2025, the acquisition of all outstanding equity interests in Encino Acquisition Partners, LLC for $5.6 billion in cash, subject to customary adjustments.
2. The transaction is expected to close by May 30, 2026, but could be extended to August 31, 2026, pending regulatory approvals.
3.  If the Purchase Agreement is terminated under certain circumstances, EOG or the other party may be required to pay a $392,000,000 termination fee.

1. On June 5, 2025, Carrier Global Corporation repurchased 4,267,425 shares of its common stock for $300 million from Viessmann HoldCo, a company controlled by a Carrier director, at a 1.5406% discount to the closing price.
2. Viessmann HoldCo, the seller of the shares, has committed not to sell any further Carrier common stock in 2025.
3. This transaction was executed under Carrier's existing share repurchase authorization.
1. Ralph Lauren Corporation completed a $500 million offering of 5.000% Senior Notes due 2032 on June 5, 2025.
2.  The net proceeds from the issuance are expected to be used for general corporate purposes, which may include repaying $400 million of existing senior notes due September 15, 2025.
3. The Underwriting Agreement includes customary representations, covenants, and indemnification provisions, and certain underwriters have existing financial dealings with the company.
1. Broadcom Inc. reported record second-quarter fiscal year 2025 revenue of $15,004 million, a 20% increase year-over-year, driven by strong demand for AI networking solutions.
2.  The company anticipates third-quarter fiscal year 2025 revenue of approximately $15.8 billion, representing a 21% year-over-year increase.
3. A quarterly cash dividend of $0.59 per share was declared, payable on June 30, 2025, to stockholders of record on June 20, 2025.
